Message.Title: “We have to pass the bill so you can find out what is in it”
Message.Msg: Finally someone has found out "what is in it", and regardless of what Nancy and Harry found out there is no truth to the rumor, let me repeat, there is absolutely no truth to the rumor, let me make myself very, very clear, there is no truth to the rumor that anyone in congress is trying to get an exemption from Obamacare for themselves or any member of their staff. As a matter of fact Harry's spokesperson said: o "Congress does not need to step in to ensure that lawmakers have the same experience as the general public." o "Senator Reid is committed to ensuring that all members of Congress and Congressional staff experience the benefits of the Affordable Care Act in exactly the same way as every other American,” And Nancy said: o "She believes the law allows lawmakers and staff to remain inside the system for federal employees, thus keeping their employer contributions — they just have to buy policies that are also offered on an exchange." So there! And let me remind you that there were no secret negotiations going on to get exemptions for congress or their staff from Obamacare, because congress is an honorable institution and all that work there are above reproach. So there! "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: “We have to pass the bill so you can find out what is in it”

Message.Msg: Recycling the phone thing again? Taxpayers don't pay for these phones and they have been around alot longer than Obama. It is part of the public mission of public utilities to extend utility services to poor households-in exchange for property easements, use of public property (including airwaves) and in some cases outright monopolies. Providing these things, including phones, is what allows us to claim we have equality of opportunity in this country. The Safelink program was pushed by Tracfone--a private company-- to expand the landline service to cell phones during the Bush years. People can get a phone and 250 free minutes. Tracfone provides the phone and the payment for minutes is from the Universal Service Fund. The phones you can get aren't exactly what most people would call "smart phones". They're not iphones, galaxies or even blackberries. They're flip phones from Motorola or Nokia. I'm not sure why you people can't be honest about these things. Maybe you don't like the program, that's fine. It's worth discussing. But you people are liars. All you do is lie. That's not fine.

Message.Msg: I wish I had a good answer for you Wilkie. Unfortunately I don't. At least not one I would put in print. It would become sociological and political. Topics I don't care to get into on the T board. I leave that for Ricky's crowd. My wife came from Winco's industry. Despite very good pay and above average benefits, the pervasive attitude of her peers is one of satisfaction. Like anyone in the labor market, they would like more, but settle for what their union bargains (settles?) for. My feeling is this. If an employee is well compensated, they have minimal complaints. I can't account for what you learned about Winco's employees. Why did you pick Winco for research? At the risk of going too far with this off-topic response, I'll let it go at that.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are killing T

Message.Msg: I think are confusing public unions with private unions. Why would teachers and government workers need fat cat union leaders to protect them? They are the last segment of society that needs unionization. The knowledgeable public...you don't qualify...knows where the dues go that are paid by public union members. Other than minimum wage and some other exceptions, I don't see any laws that you mention which guarantees wage increases and benefits to the average blue collar worker. Why do I need to pay a teacher or government employees lifetime benefits? Let them do as I did. Save and prepare for it without expecting taxpayers to carry the load. You're stupid instigating and trolling have just about run its course. And stop using "Peace" at the end of your insipid posts. You insult it's meaning.

Message.Title: Just switched services from Comcast to AT&T
Message.Msg: In a word AT&T...SUCKS ! They have sent technician after technician to correct problems they created switching services over to them. One technician who spent most of the day trying to fix a problem(won't go into details) seemed to be perplexed and dumbfounded said he would be back the next day,that he would call me around 8 or 8:30 a.m. first. Never got a call from him so I called him and he said he had a job to do first then he would make me the next stop,,,,did not happen,,,not even a courtesy call,zip,zero,nada....MIA.We use the internet to conduct business and suffice it to say this was not good for business.I've had more problems with AT&T in a two week period than I have had with comcast over a 3 year period. Sell this POS.

Topic.Title: Just switched services from Comcast to AT&T

Message.Msg: I clicked on his name just to see his other posts. Got a tip about KOG and checked it out. I think he's got something there so I bought some September 8 calls. By the way, I am not a closet shorter on T. I just buy puts when it looks like it has gone up too far too fast. Glad I did before the 5% drop. Now I have 70 call contracts and only 10 puts on T and the puts are weekly May 3 contracts. My weekly routine is to go into the new week with 10 calls and 10 puts of about equal value. On Monday I will place a GTC order on both to sell at a bit more than twice what I paid for it. The one that sells covers my total investment and the one that is left is clear profit if I can sell it. Most of the time it works.
You're too superstitious - you think anything posted here matters in any way, shape or form? lol If I had the power to jinx a lot of people would be in a lot of trouble!

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are killing T

Message.Msg: Teachers need unions as badly as any group. There are teachers, who actualy DO the work, then there are administrators, who, before unions, could fiire a teacher for any reason. Reasons like they were older, their nephew needed a job, etc. Teachers pay plenty into their retirement plans, get low pay over their career compared to others, and deserve every penny of their money, not your, their. You got no matching 10% on your retirent from your employer? That's a common figure. If you were "able to save" it means "you weren't paid poverty level wages" either.

Topic.Title: Finally some real bipartisanship

Message.Msg: Everyone know exactly why this happened as it did, these shameless fools in Congress either don't think we're that smart or they just flat out don't care what we think. There might be a bit of both involved, but heavy on the 'they just don't care'. Obama was offered this opportunity as the sequester was starting to unfold and turned it down. He had an opportunity to turn down the sequester completely but refused to negotiate and said it would never happen anyway. In his speech at the Bush gathering yesterday he commented about how all President's make mistakes, I sure he didn't mean it, but he has certainly made his share recently. He won't admit it of course, he will simply say that Congress is not doing his job and he will for once be absolutely correct. I hope there are some conservative air traffic guys out there that will intentionally slow down their work to make a few of these royalty thinking clowns sit on a runway for a few hours.

Topic.Title: Has congress finally gone too far?

Message.Msg: Q: Was this program instituted by the Obama administration? A: No. Nor was it just instituted "earlier this year," as the email claims. The program as it exists today was created over a decade ago by an act of Congress, the Telecommunications Act of 1996. A version of the Lifeline program was already in operation as far back as the early 1980s. There is no Obama Phone, no welfare phone. Your Grandma probably gets the discount and has for about 30 years. hahahahahahha

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Msg: In the 90′s, the federal government set up the Lifeline phone service program via a mandate by the FCC. This program, funded by Universal Service Fund fees on telephone bills, provides qualified consumers with discounted (often free) monthly telephone service. It began as just a landline program and a few years ago made it’s debut with cell phones. It’s been commonly called the “Obama phone” but that’s an urban legend as free cell phones were added under the Bush Administration. there yoiu go, story teller. hahahahahaha

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ... “All hope abandon, ye who enter in.” – Dante Alighieri “I'm just going to say this to Boston: Thank you. Thank you for once again, in the face of gross inhumanity, inspiring and solidifying my belief in humanity and the people of this country.” – Jon Stewart "Whoever did this obviously did not know #$%$ about the people of Boston. Because nothing these terrorists do is going to shake them. For Pete's sake, Boston was founded by the pilgrims — a people so tough they had to buckle their hats on. It is the cradle of the American revolution. A city that withstood an 86-year losing streak. A city that made it through the Big Dig, a construction project that backed up traffic for 16 years — I mean, there are commuters just getting home now. Even their bands are tough. It's the hometown of Aerosmith, who are, in their fifth decade, still going strong. Even Steven Tyler looks fantastic, for a 73-year-old woman.” – Stephen Colbert “Nothing sedates rationality like large doses of effortless money. After a heady experience of that kind, normally sensible people drift into behavior akin to that of Cinderella at the ball. They know that overstaying the festivities — that is, continuing to speculate in companies that have gigantic valuations relative to the cash they are likely to generate in the future — will eventually bring on pumpkins and mice. But they nevertheless hate to miss a single minute of what is one helluva party. Therefore, the giddy participants all plan to leave just seconds before midnight. There's a problem, though: They are dancing in a room in which the clocks have no hands.” – Warren Buffet “Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.” – Aldous Huxley "After a very difficult week, it's good to know that bad guys don't get away with it. We caught the Ricin guy. We caught the bombers. This is a powerful message from our government; we will not be intimidated by bombs, we will not be intimidated by poison. This is America. If you are a violent, paranoid lunatic, you must use a gun." - Bill Maher “Nice work if you can get it, and you can get it if you try.” – Ira Gershwin “I made out with a homeless guy by accident. I had no idea -- he was really tan, he had no shoes on. I just thought it was, like, his thang, you know? I was like, 'He's probably in a band‘!“ – Amy Schumer "U.S. intelligence agencies have put together a psychological profile of Kim Jong Un. They say he's a narcissist, and he is obsessed with Hollywood, obsessed with plastic surgery, and obsessed with the NBA. It's a condition we know as 'Kardashianism’.” - Jay Leno “One thing you learned as a Cubs fan: when you bought you ticket, you could bank on seeing the bottom of the ninth.” – Joe Garagiola

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ...“Nothing in fine print is ever good news.“ – Andy Rooney “I'm single. I often think about my future wife and how lax she's been about getting in touch with me.“ – jon “President Obama offered to wash senators' car if it would lead to an immigration bill. Senators then told Obama, 'If you're going to wash our cars, why do we need immigrants?" - Conan O'Brien “Blessed is he who expects nothing for he shall never be disappointed.” – Alexander Pope “If tie is like kissing your sister, losing is like kissing you grandmother with her teeth out.” – George Brett "Why does the government charge us postage to send in our tax returns? We have to pay them to pay them. It's like giving a slice back to the pizza delivery guy. How about you just deduct 75 cents from what I already paid?"- Jimmy Kimmel “The language of God is not English or Latin; the language of God is cellular and molecular.” – Timothy Leary “People say to me, ‘Bill, are you an optimist?’ And I say, ‘I hope so’!” – Bill Bailey “Today, North Korea celebrated the 101st birthday of their country's founder. He famously said, 'Let's have a #$%$ version of South Korea. We can do that’.” - Conan O'Brien “My grandfather invented the cold air balloon…but it never really took off.” – Milton Jones

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ...“Anyone who believes exponential growth can go on forever in a finite world is either a madman or an economist.” – Kenneth Boulding “Can you say seriously The Bill of Rights could get through Congress today? It wouldn’t even get out of committee.” – F. Lee Bailey, 1967 "90 percent of people support background checks, which means even people who can't pass a background check support background checks." - Bill Maher “Morality has nothing in common with politics.” – Bob Dylan “The tendency to turn human judgments into divine commands makes religion one of the most dangerous forces in the world.” – Georgia Harkness "Happy birthday to Israel. The country of Israel turned 65. Now that it's 65, Israel plans to retire and move to Florida." - Conan O'Brien “Space and Time! now I see it is true, what I guess'd at, What I guess'd when I loaf'd on the grass, What I guess'd while I lay alone in my bed, And again as I walk'd the beach under the paling stars of the morning. My ties and ballasts leave me, my elbows rest in sea-gaps, I skirt sierras, my palms cover continents, I am afoot with my vision.” – Walt Whitman “It is now quite lawful for a Catholic woman to avoid pregnancy by a resort to mathematics, though she is still forbidden to resort to physics or chemistry.” - H.L. Mencken, 1956 “I would start a revolution, but I just bought a hammock.” – Zach Galifianakis “Hate less, live longer.” - Terri Guillemets "Senator John McCain went on TV this week to call Kim Jong-Un a clown and a fool. As you know, according to John McCain, that would still make him eligible to be vice president." - Jay Leno “Beware the Wrath of Grapes!” - anonymous “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 “Mine eyes make pictures, when they are shut.” – Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Topic.Title: The market closed up 11.75 today

Message.Msg: "This is to the idiot that said the market was down" Speaking of idiots, look at this idiotic posting by Raystock from the aapl message board "raystock48079 • 7 hours ago Flag AAPL is up as posted yesterday I told everyone to buy at 308.00 today if you listen to me you are in the m oney" The problem is that the 52 week low of aapl is $385.10 so no one who Raystock told could buy even if they wanted to.
